Replaced usage of Avalon Context with Myrmidon specific Context:* Moved read-only property and resolve methods from TaskContext to new Contextn  interface.  TaskContext now extends the new Context interface.nn* Changed the Configurer methods to use the new Context.  Both implementationsn  use the supplied Context to do property resolution.nn* Renamed TaskContext.getPropertys() -> getProperties().nn* Moved PropertyUtil from configurer to workspace package, as that is nown  the only place it is used.nn* Changed PropertyUtil to work with the new Context.nnRoleManager:nn* A default implementation for a role can now be specified.  Currentlyn  can only do this programatically.nnDefaultMasterConverter:nn* Removed MasterConverter interface.  It is now identified by the Convertern  role.nn* Now caches the converter instances.nn* Changed the converter search algorithm to traverse the *source* classn  hierarchy, including all interfaces.  Chooses the most specialisedn  conversion, and fails if there is more than one such choice.nnDefaultConfigurer:nn* Attempts to convert references, if the type does not match the expected type.nn* Changed handling of nested elements, for named adders/setters:n  * If the method type can be mapped to a role, and that role has a defaultnimplementation, then use that default implementation.n  * Otherwise, if the method type is an interface, fail.n  * Otherwise, create an instance using no-args constructor.nn* Changed handling of nested elements, for typed adders/setters:n  * If the method type can be mapped to a role, and the element name isna type of that role, then use that role to create the instance.n  * Otherwise, use the type factory for the generic data-type role.n  * Attempt to convert the instance if it is not of the expected type.nn* Added a bunch of test cases for new functionality.nn* Renamed all the ConfigTest classes to have descriptive names.nnMisc:nn* Renamed package framework.factorys -> framework.factories.nn* Made tests work when fork = false.nnngit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/ant/core/trunk@271539 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68n

First revision of an example non blocking read operation. The servlet specification, and discussions on the expert group are quite contradictory. According to the specification request response object can only live during service() or when an AsyncContext is present. but the NIO api is written with examples of bypassing both.So for this iteration, we are working with the assumption that nNIO is only allowed during async operations, otherwise there is no point to NIO.nThis is because polling was not allowed, so there is no point to have NIO when the thread is presentnnnngit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/tomcat/trunk@1357039 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68n

Tweak cache defaults to be more reasonableWe reduce the default cache.diff.memoryLimit as the entries are nownrather large, 1024 may rip through some JVMs entire memory heap andnleave nothing left.  Since there is no way to tell Ehcache that onenentry is larger than another and force expire earlier than it wantsnwe sort of get stuck with needing to cap the entry count.nnWe also reduce the cache.openid.memoryLimit as this cache typicallynonly has 20 or so entries on review.source.android.com, and most ofnthem are likely expired.  Due to the very short TTL on the entriesnthe cache only needs to hold the number of authentications which wendo in a 5 minute window, and this is a fairly low figure.nnWe also modify the web_sessions cache to prefer an LRU expire overnan LFR expire.  This should keep help accessed sessions to be morenlikely to stay in memory over being evicted when the cache gets tona larger size.nnBug: GERRIT-266nChange-Id: I6e2e67d4e7f0bb2131005627a1e0d446d9990b60nSigned-off-by: Shawn O. Pearce <sop@google.com>n

Include a UUID portion in NoteDb author identitiesAuthor identities include per-server specific account IDs, so it isnnot safe to mix IDs from different servers. Ensure each server onlynever produces identities with one ID during its lifetime, by writingnout a random UUID to gerrit.config as gerrit.serverId. This happensnduring init, and optionally lazily during startup.nnFor now NoteDb changes can be migrated between servers as long as thisnfile is kept intact. Eventually, when federating changes betweennservers, we will need come up with some mechanism for coalescingnvarious per-server identities into a single account, like the currentnAccountExternalId mapping (except not exactly that because Shawnnregrets it). Such a mechanism will simply need to know how to handlenthis kind of UUID format.nnChange-Id: I9492c9c561892488703d15f7cde6094aa03f957bn

This patch adds bunch of minor features to the configurer:* Added max multiplicity checking.  Properties with a setter method can onlynbe set once, whereas properties with an adder method can be set an unlimitednnumber of times.nn* Resolves properties in reference ids.  e.gnn  <javac classpath-ref=${my-classpath-id-name}/>nn* Ignores String adder and setter methods, if other methods exist.  Longernterm, the type should be able to specify exactly which method to use.nn* Moved all per-object state behind the ConfigurationState interface.  ThenObjectConfigurer is now responsible for state-based validation.nn* Tidied-up error messages.  More context info is available in errornmessages, to make figuring out the problem easier.  Error messages stillnneed work.nnngit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/ant/core/trunk@270822 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68n

Do not use Reader and Writer classes for writing response, because it will use the default content encoding of the JRE, causing the reply from the mirror to not be an exact copy of the incoming request. Therefore, rather use InputStream and OutputStream.If the mirror gets a header specifying the content length, we know how much data to read, and therefore we can allow the reading to block waiting for more data to appear.nFor chunked transfer, we still have to only read until there is no more data, and not block to wait for more.nnAdd unit test for the mirror thread. This will expose the problems of the previous version of the HttpMirrorThread, and show that the version of HttpMirrorThread in this changelist works.nngit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/jmeter/trunk@584508 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68n

Use TestProtocol to clone in-process for AbstractDaemonTestThis new JGit feature associates a particular request object with anURL and processes all git protocol requests in-memory in a separatenthread. For acceptance tests, this request object also describes anrequest scope context, such that each connection runs in its ownnconnection thread with its own Guice request context.nnThe TestProtocol instance uses custom Upload/ReceivePackFactorynimplementations that parallel the implementations within the HTTP andnSSH code paths. On the one hand, this is yet another implementationnthat must be modified when changing the git filter stack, but on thenother hand, there were already multiple stacks to begin with. In thisncase, I think the performance improvement is also worth the cost.nnWith this change, single acceptance test methods can run in aboutn100ms even on my Macbook Air. Startup cost is still relatively highndue to server initialization, but this change opens the door tonreducing that well by removing HTTP and SSH servers from testsnentirely.nnChange-Id: Icddd7d2ac448ea3f59909f8ef61f95feb1d67b64n

Embed Jetty and run it out of `java -jar gerrit.war daemon`We now include Jetty 7.x as part of our distribution WAR and allownadministrators to launch the embedded copy using our Daemon commandnline program.  This vastly simplifies server installation as youndo not need to download the Jetty servlet container and configurenit prior to using Gerrit Code Review.nnConfiguration of Jetty is performed using our gerrit.config, rathernthan the Jetty XML configuration language.  Jettys language can benquite a bit more powerful for isoteric configurations, but we wantnto embed Jetty to simplify setup, not complicate it.  Gerrits ownnconfiguration file in the git syntax is simpler, so we stick withnthat and offer a limited subset of Jettys configuration featuresnthrough httpd.* properties.nnLogging currently goes only to stderr, which is fine for toy setupsnbut probably not ideal for a production environment.nnUnfortunately we are still relying on GerritServer.properties tonget us the database connection information, and this DataSource isnnot pooled.  Thus the web handlers in our embedded container willnrun slightly slower then the web handlers in a standalone container,nas the latter will be likely be using a connection pool configurednout of the containers JNDI namespace.nnBug: issue 202nChange-Id: Ia7956ba48cbc3a8d4241101db5ff493e16d26b9fnSigned-off-by: Shawn O. Pearce <sop@google.com>n

Dont aggressively flush objects when mergingThis is a long story. We originally tried this about a year ago withnIa85c5114, but that was doomed (reverted in Id691318a) as we couldntnguarantee PatchSet objects wouldnt be written before the inserter wasnflushed. That experience directly led to the introduction ofnBatchUpdate in I0771f5e8, which finally culminated in convertingnMergeOp to BatchUpdate in I1d9883a5[1].nnNow, we can close the door on this chapter and finally avoid flushingneach new commit as soon as its created. It is now easy to prove thatnno PatchSets are written pointing to new SHA-1s before they arenflushed, since commits are created in updateRepo and patch sets arenupdated in updateChange.nnThe lone exception is in CherryPickChange, where the BatchUpdatencreation cant easily be hoisted higher, because we have to parsenobjects from the repo in order to determine which Change.Id thenoperation applies to. But here we can ensure flushing happens bynpassing the same ObjectInserter to any BatchUpdates.nnThis should substantially improve performance of all merge strategiesnthat create one commit per submitted change (MergeAlways, CherryPick,nRebaseIfNecessary), particularly on slow backends.nn[1] The astute reader will notice I have also justified the existencenof BatchUpdate as making the notedb transition easier by being onenplace to create ChangeUpdates, enforce ordering, eventually havenretry logic, etc. That is all true, but it turns out its not thenoriginal motivation.nnChange-Id: Icba6262383088fe24b81ec7159511d80ae31724en
